policyMIB.name: policyMIB

revisions.description: Defined bit 0 of polL2Dot1qVlanStaticProtocols as reserved.
Revision #5. Add static VLAN protocol filtering to the polL2Group. Update contact information.
Revision #3. Define Policy Based Routing in polL4Group.
Revision #2. Define Layer 2 flow security objects in polL2Group.
Revision #1. Define Layer 3 flow objects in polL3Group.

policyMIB.contactinfo: Postal: Enterasys Networks 50 Minuteman Rd. Andover, MA 01810-1008 USA Phone: +1 978 684 1000 E-mail: support@enterasys.com WWW: http://www.enterasys.com
policyMIB.description: This module defines a schema to control filters on a device capable of Layer 3 filters also called Access Control Lists (ACLs) and at layer 2. It may also be used to configure static IP routes that use other IP header fields in addition to destination IP address.

InterfaceIndex.name: InterfaceIndex
InterfaceIndex.description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface or interface sub-layer in the managed system. It is recommended that values are assigned contiguously starting from 1. The value for each interface sub- layer must remain constant at least from one re- initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

InterfaceIndexOrZero.name: InterfaceIndexOrZero
InterfaceIndexOrZero.description: This textual convention is an extension of the InterfaceIndex convention. The latter defines a greater than zero value used to identify an interface or interface sub-layer in the managed system. This extension permits the additional value of zero. the value zero is object-specific and must therefore be defined as part of the description of any object which uses this syntax. Examples of the usage of zero might include situations where interface was unknown, or when none or all interfaces need to be referenced.

SSRPortComparator.name: SSRPortComparator
SSRPortComparator.description: Comparison operator used by ACL's to permit src/dst port addresses.

SSRsocketId.name: SSRsocketId
SSRsocketId.description: A TCP or UDP port or socket end point.

SSRVlanIndex.name: SSRVlanIndex
SSRVlanIndex.description: An 802.1Q VLAN Identifier with same semantics as Q-BRIDGE-MIB VlanId. SSR uses Vid 1 for the default VLAN. All ports by default belong to this VLAN unless assigned to one or more user defined VLANs. A value of 4100 is used to match all VLANs. 4094 to 4099 are reserved local VLAN ids on the SSR.

SSRPortList.name: SSRPortList
SSRPortList.description: List of ifIndexes that make up the ports to apply a layer 2 filter to. The ifIndexes are numbered sparsely starting from 1. An example string might be: 1,2,32 1,6,9, Each ifIndex must represent a physical port or link aggregation aka Smart Trunk ifType of propMultiplexor(54). Note ifIndexes may change across system resets per RFC 2233.

SSRFlowPolicyType.name: SSRFlowPolicyType
SSRFlowPolicyType.description: Type of Flow Policy. permitFlow allows matching traffic to be forwarded. denyFlow causes matching traffic to be discarded.

SSRFlowPolicyAction.name: SSRFlowPolicyAction
SSRFlowPolicyAction.description: When deciding when to apply policy there are three potential methods. policyBeforeRouteLookup provides a way to special case normal traffic patterns so that certain traffic can be routed according to policy. policyAfterRouteLookup is useful when a default route does not exist and the traffic to route does not match existing route tables. useOnlyPolicyLookup bypasses normal route lookup altogether.

SSRFlowPolicyAclList.name: SSRFlowPolicyAclList
SSRFlowPolicyAclList.description: A blank separated list of ACL names used to match flows against from the polAclTable. The keyword, everything, may be used to match all traffic. ASCII printable characters only

SSRFlowNextHopList.name: SSRFlowNextHopList
SSRFlowNextHopList.description: A blank separated list of from one to four l4fNextHopRouter ipaddresses or the keyword null. Null represents the null interface

SSRFlowLoadPolicy.name: SSRFlowLoadPolicy
SSRFlowLoadPolicy.description: round robin evenly distributes flows among the next hops. firstAvailable will make flows go to the first available next hop in the ordered list.

polAclServer.name: polAclServer
polAclServer.description: This is true when Access Control Lists (ACLs) are defined by a Policy Server else false. At boot, this value is false. After the first valid set of any policy object, the value changes to true.

polAclNumber.name: polAclNumber
polAclNumber.description: The number of Layer 3 Access Control Lists defined in the SSR.

polAclLastChanged.name: polAclLastChanged
polAclLastChanged.description: The time the Access Control List were last changed.

polAclTable.name: polAclTable
polAclTable.description: A list of Access Control List entries.

polAclEntry.name: polAclEntry
polAclEntry.description: A record containing a Access Control List.

polAclName.name: polAclName
polAclName.description: The administratively assigned name to this static route entry.

polAclItem.name: polAclItem
polAclItem.description: This row's unique identifier within a given ACL set. Member of the ACL set are numbered from 1 to 256. If Item is set to 0, and rowStatus is destroy, all rows for this set are destroyed.

polAclRestriction.name: polAclRestriction
polAclRestriction.description: The permissions/restrictions given to this static route entry.

polAclProtocol.name: polAclProtocol
polAclProtocol.description: The IETF protocol this ACL applies to.

polAclSrcIp.name: polAclSrcIp
polAclSrcIp.description: The source L3 IP Address this ACL applies to.

polAclSrcMask.name: polAclSrcMask
polAclSrcMask.description: The source L3 IP Mask this ACL Applies to.

polAclDstIp.name: polAclDstIp
polAclDstIp.description: The source L3 IP Address this ACL applies to.

polAclDstMask.name: polAclDstMask
polAclDstMask.description: The source L3 IP Mask this ACL Applies to.

polAclTOS.name: polAclTOS
polAclTOS.description: The source L3 IP Type of Service field.

polAclSrcPort.name: polAclSrcPort
polAclSrcPort.description: The source L3 IP source port/socket ACL applies to.

polAclDstPort.name: polAclDstPort
polAclDstPort.description: The source L3 IP destination port/socket ACL applies to.

polAclSrcOperator.name: polAclSrcOperator
polAclSrcOperator.description: polAclSrcPort is compared using this operator.

polAclDstOperator.name: polAclDstOperator
polAclDstOperator.description: polAclDstPort is compared using this operator.

polAclSrcHighRange.name: polAclSrcHighRange
polAclSrcHighRange.description: The high range source L3 IP port. Used only when SrcOperator == range. polAclSrcPort is used as the lower bounds of the range.

polAclDstHighRange.name: polAclDstHighRange
polAclDstHighRange.description: The high range destination L3 IP port. Used only when SrcOperator == range. polAclDstPort is used as the lower bounds of the range.

polAclAuditTrail.name: polAclAuditTrail
polAclAuditTrail.description: Flows matching this ACL are logged for Accounting when true.

polAclCheckpoint.name: polAclCheckpoint
polAclCheckpoint.description: How long to keep flow at which point a checkpoint should be done. A checkpoint may trigger earlier than this time should the maximum batch size be reached.

polAclRowStatus.name: polAclRowStatus
polAclRowStatus.description: SNMP V2 RowStatus control for this table.

polAclServiceNumber.name: polAclServiceNumber
polAclServiceNumber.description: The number of Layer 3 Access Control Lists in service in the SSR.

polAclServiceLastChanged.name: polAclServiceLastChanged
polAclServiceLastChanged.description: The time the ACLs in service were last changed.

polAclServiceTable.name: polAclServiceTable
polAclServiceTable.description: A list of ACL's currently in service.

polAclServiceEntry.name: polAclServiceEntry
polAclServiceEntry.description: A record containing a Access Control Lists applied to Interfaces.

polAclServiceIfIndex.name: polAclServiceIfIndex
polAclServiceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the IP Interface the ACL is applied to. An SSR IP Interface has ifType 142

polAclName2.name: polAclName2
polAclName2.description: The name of the ACL applied to the particular port.

polAclServiceDirection.name: polAclServiceDirection
polAclServiceDirection.description: The direction the ACL is applied to the particular port.

polAclServiceRowStatus.name: polAclServiceRowStatus
polAclServiceRowStatus.description: SNMP V2 RowStatus control for this table.

polAclRemoteAllowed.name: polAclRemoteAllowed
polAclRemoteAllowed.description: Remote Policy Configuration is allowed when true only local (to SSR) policy may be applied.

polAclInterfaceNumber.name: polAclInterfaceNumber
polAclInterfaceNumber.description: The number of Layer 3 Interfaces in service in the SSR.

polAclInterfaceLastChanged.name: polAclInterfaceLastChanged
polAclInterfaceLastChanged.description: The time the Interfaces in service were last changed with regard to policy.

polAclInterfaceTable.name: polAclInterfaceTable
polAclInterfaceTable.description: A list of IP Interfaces in service and their policy status. Each IP Interface can be defined to use local static policy or remote dynamic policy in the config.

polAclInterfaceEntry.name: polAclInterfaceEntry
polAclInterfaceEntry.description: A record containing a Access Control Lists applied to Interfaces.

polAclInterfaceIfIndex.name: polAclInterfaceIfIndex
polAclInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the IP Interface the ACL is applied to.

polAclInterfaceDirection.name: polAclInterfaceDirection
polAclInterfaceDirection.description: The direction the ACL is applied to the particular port.

polAclPolicyStatus.name: polAclPolicyStatus
polAclPolicyStatus.description: Rules for what type of management can apply ACLs to a particular interface. If set to remote, then a Policy Manager via SNMP may change dynamically the ACLs applied to an interface. Note, ACLs applied dynamically are not maintained across system reboot. Use local ACLs to setup the basic rules then apply dynamic rules as necessary.

polL2FilterNumber.name: polL2FilterNumber
polL2FilterNumber.description: The number of Layer 3 Access Control Lists defined in the SSR.

polL2FilterLastChanged.name: polL2FilterLastChanged
polL2FilterLastChanged.description: The time the Access Control List were last changed.

polL2FilterEntry.name: polL2FilterEntry
polL2FilterEntry.description: An entry containing a layer 2 filter.

polL2FilterIndex.name: polL2FilterIndex
polL2FilterIndex.description: A unique index into the table representing a single filter entry. This value will remain unique and the relationship between the index and the underlying filter is valid until the next reboot.

polL2FilterDesc.name: polL2FilterDesc
polL2FilterDesc.description: A string used to describe the filter. It should contain the creator IP address, and other descriptive information about the filter. It is recommended that names be unique within a given filter type. This object may not be modified if the associated. polL2FilterStatus object is equal to active(1).

polL2FilterType.name: polL2FilterType
polL2FilterType.description: The types of filters, as explained below. static-entry Based on the restrictions and the presence of source, destination MAC address they can be of three types : source-static-entry - All frames with a source address equal to srcMAC, coming through any of the inPorts will be allowed/disallowed to go to any port that is a member of the outPorts list. destination-static-entry - All frames with a destination address equal to dstMAC, coming through any of the inPorts will be allowed/ disallowed/forced to go to any port that is a member of the outPorts list. flow-static-entry - All frames with a source address equal to srcMAC and a destination address equal to dstMAC, coming through any of the inPorts list will be allowed/disallowed to go to any port that is a member of the outPorts list. Ports must be in flow-bridging mode in order to use filters with both src and dst mac specified. address-filter Based on the restrictions and the presence of source, destination MAC address they can be of three types : source-address-filter - All frames with a source address equal to srcMAC, coming through any of the inPorts will be filtered out. destination-address-filter - All frames with a destination address equal to dstMAC, coming through any of the inPorts will be filtered out. flow-filter - All frames with a source address equal to srcMAC and a destination address equal to dstMAC, coming through any of the inPorts list will be filtered out. Ports must be in flow mode in order to set a filter using both source and destination address. port-address-lock This locks a source address to a port. It allows learning of srcMAC addresses only on any of the ports in inPorts. The following objects are mandatory and must be set by mgmt station to activate a row: polL2FilterDesc, polL2FilterSrcMacAddr, polL2FilterInPorts secure-port This blocks all traffic in a given direction to a port. Used with static entries, it is effective in allowing only certain well defined source/destination mac addresses. The following objects must be set by mgmt station to activate an entry: polL2FilterDesc, r, polL2FilterInPorts This object may not be modified if the associated. polL2FilterStatus object is equal to active(1).

polL2FilterRestrictions.name: polL2FilterRestrictions
polL2FilterRestrictions.description: The first 3 restrictions, allow, disallow, force apply when the filterType is static-entry. When polL2FilterType is addressFilter or portAddressLock, this object does not apply. For securePort, the blockIngress, blockEgress values apply. This object may not be modified if the associated. polL2FilterStatus object is equal to active(1).

polL2FilterSrcMacAddr.name: polL2FilterSrcMacAddr
polL2FilterSrcMacAddr.description: The source MAC address, which is present in case of a Flow, that has been learned by the switch.

polL2FilterDstMacAddr.name: polL2FilterDstMacAddr
polL2FilterDstMacAddr.description: The destination MAC address which has been learned. This object may not be modified if the associated. polL2FilterStatus object is equal to active(1).

polL2FilterVlanId.name: polL2FilterVlanId
polL2FilterVlanId.description: The VLAN the destination MAC address belongs to. The default VLAN is id 1 on SSR. This object may not be modified if the associated. polL2FilterStatus object is equal to active(1).

polL2FilterInPorts.name: polL2FilterInPorts
polL2FilterInPorts.description: The set of Ports to which this filter applies on input. This object may not be modified if the associated. polL2FilterStatus object is equal to active(1).

polL2FilterOutPorts.name: polL2FilterOutPorts
polL2FilterOutPorts.description: The set of ports to which this filter applies on output. This object may not be modified if the associated. polL2FilterStatus object is equal to active(1).

polL2FilterCreationTime.name: polL2FilterCreationTime
polL2FilterCreationTime.description: The value of sysUpTime when this filter was made active(1).

polL2FilterStatus.name: polL2FilterStatus
polL2FilterStatus.description: SMIv2 RowStatus control for this table. Use createAndWait or createAndGo to create a filter, use destroy to remove an entry or notInService to disengage a filter without destroying it. A row in the notReady state has not had all the mandatory objects set.

polL2Dot1qVlanStaticTable.name: polL2Dot1qVlanStaticTable
polL2Dot1qVlanStaticTable.description: A table containing hardware specific VLAN behavior configuration information for VLANs created with the dot1qVlanStaticTable. Configuration information for each VLAN configured into the device by (local or network) management.

polL2Dot1qVlanStaticEntry.name: polL2Dot1qVlanStaticEntry
polL2Dot1qVlanStaticEntry.description: An entry containing additional hardware specific objects for a dot1qVlanStaticEntry.

polL2Dot1qVlanStaticProtocols.name: polL2Dot1qVlanStaticProtocols
polL2Dot1qVlanStaticProtocols.description: Specifies the types of traffic that will be forwarded on this VLAN. Protocols not set in this definition will be filtered. The types of protocols supported on this VLAN corresponds to the type option in the CLI command vlan create <vlan name> <type>. If no protocols are specified, all protocols are forwarded. This corresponds to the port-based CLI option. reserved(0) - this bit is reserved and has no defined behavior. bridged-protocols(1) - this VLAN supports all bridged protocols excluding IP and IPX. Includes appletalk(4), dec(5), sna(6), and ipv6(7) if none of these protocols are set. If any are set, only those that are set are included. ip(2) - this VLAN supports IP protocol. ipx(3) - this VLAN supports IPX protocol. appletalk(4) - this VLAN supports Appletalk protocol. dec(5) - this VLAN supports DEC protocol. sna(6) - this VLAN supports SNA protocol. ipv6(7) - this VLAN supports IPv6 protocol.

polL2Dot1qVlanStaticL4Bridging.name: polL2Dot1qVlanStaticL4Bridging
polL2Dot1qVlanStaticL4Bridging.description: If this object has a value of false(2), the L4 Bridging feature is not enabled on this VLAN. If this object has a value of true(1), the L4 Bridging feature is enabled for this VLAN. This corresponds to the CLI command vlan enable l4-bridging.

polL4PolicyBasedRoutingEnabled.name: polL4PolicyBasedRoutingEnabled
polL4PolicyBasedRoutingEnabled.description: The state of Policy Based Routing on this network element.

polL4NumRouters.name: polL4NumRouters
polL4NumRouters.description: The number of next hop routers currently available.

polL4NextHopTableLastChange.name: polL4NextHopTableLastChange
polL4NextHopTableLastChange.description: The value of sysUpTime when a row was last added or deleted from polL4NextHopTable.

polL4NextHopTable.name: polL4NextHopTable
polL4NextHopTable.description: A list of next hop IP routers.

polL4NextHopEntry.name: polL4NextHopEntry
polL4NextHopEntry.description: An entry contains the status of a next hop router.

polL4NextHopRouter.name: polL4NextHopRouter
polL4NextHopRouter.description: The IP Address of the next hop router flow will be sent to.

polL4NextHopState.name: polL4NextHopState
polL4NextHopState.description: The current status of the polL4NextHopRouter. If no entry found when a policy route is activated, then arp for the request the state will be waitingForArp(2). If a reply is found the state will go to macAcquired(3) else noArpReply(4). If NextHop is not local, mac is actual nexthop router.

polL4NextHopPortOfExit.name: polL4NextHopPortOfExit
polL4NextHopPortOfExit.description: IfIndex of port we learned this router on or else zero if not known.

polL4NextHopMacAddress.name: polL4NextHopMacAddress
polL4NextHopMacAddress.description: MAC Address of next hop router learned from ARP.

polL4NextHopLastChange.name: polL4NextHopLastChange
polL4NextHopLastChange.description: The value of sysUpTime when this polL4NextHopState changed.

polL4lowControlTableLastChange.name: polL4lowControlTableLastChange
polL4lowControlTableLastChange.description: The value of sysUpTime when a row was last added or deleted from polL4lowControlTable.

polL4NumPolicies.name: polL4NumPolicies
polL4NumPolicies.description: The number of policies currently available.

polL4lowControlTable.name: polL4lowControlTable
polL4lowControlTable.description: Contains Control rows that indicate which flows have been redirected. As flows are aged out and recreated, these rules will enforce flow redirection policy.

polL4lowControlEntry.name: polL4lowControlEntry
polL4lowControlEntry.description: This table is an ordered collection of route policies. For SSR, this maps to the command: ip-policy Name [permit|deny] acl acl-list

polL4PolicyName.name: polL4PolicyName
polL4PolicyName.description: A unique name for this flow policy.

polL4PolicySequence.name: polL4PolicySequence
polL4PolicySequence.description: The evaluation order of this object. When two objects have the same value, the value of the instance value decides which is evaluated first. than higher numbers.

polL4PolicyInstance.name: polL4PolicyInstance
polL4PolicyInstance.description: The sequence of this policy based route. Lower numbers have higher precedence than higher numbers.

polL4PolicyType.name: polL4PolicyType
polL4PolicyType.description: Controls if packets are forwarded or not for this policy.

polL4PolicyAction.name: polL4PolicyAction
polL4PolicyAction.description: Define when this policy should be used during normal packet forwarding process.

polL4PolicyMatch.name: polL4PolicyMatch
polL4PolicyMatch.description: Up to twenty (20) separate ACLs may be defined to match for this policy. This object is mandatory. Use active row from polAclTable.

polL4PolicyNextHops.name: polL4PolicyNextHops
polL4PolicyNextHops.description: Up to for IpAddresses may be specified to route data to next. Load balancing If more than one next hop ip address is specified, the default load balancing scheme is round robin. This object is mandatory. Use objects from polL4NextHopTable.

polL4PolicyLoading.name: polL4PolicyLoading
polL4PolicyLoading.description: When more than one next hop is defined and available, set loading policy here.

polL4PolicyWatch.name: polL4PolicyWatch
polL4PolicyWatch.description: When True, use icmp echo to actively maintain status of next hop. This is useful to prevent data sinks with static routes.

polL4lowCreationTime.name: polL4lowCreationTime
polL4lowCreationTime.description: The value of sysUpTime when policy went was created then activated.

polL4lowActiveGates.name: polL4lowActiveGates
polL4lowActiveGates.description: The number of currently active nexthop gateways.

polL4lowAppliedTimes.name: polL4lowAppliedTimes
polL4lowAppliedTimes.description: The number of times this policy was used.

polL4lowControlStatus.name: polL4lowControlStatus
polL4lowControlStatus.description: Entries in active state cause a flow to remain programmed with the next hop router specified. If the next hop router goes down, the rowStatus will become inactive. New flows that match this specification will assume this next hop router over any other route directive. This assumes polL4PolicyBasedRouteState value is true.

polL4lowLostRouters.name: polL4lowLostRouters
polL4lowLostRouters.description: The count of times routers were disabled from NextHopTable due to lost contact.

polL4lowControlTableActivates.name: polL4lowControlTableActivates
polL4lowControlTableActivates.description: The count of successful activations of flow control policies made.

polL4lowControlTableActivateFails.name: polL4lowControlTableActivateFails
polL4lowControlTableActivateFails.description: The count of unsuccessful flow control policies made.

polL4lowArpMappingChanges.name: polL4lowArpMappingChanges
polL4lowArpMappingChanges.description: The count of mac to next hop IP address mapping changes affecting policy based route tables.

polL4lowIcmpRedirects.name: polL4lowIcmpRedirects
polL4lowIcmpRedirects.description: The count of next hop route redirects received that match a policy in the polL4lowControlTable. This can help to determine if bad route policies are in effect.

polL4lowMatchAttempts.name: polL4lowMatchAttempts
polL4lowMatchAttempts.description: The count of total number of policy based flow lookups made against policy based route table.

polComplianceV10.name: polComplianceV10
polComplianceV10.description: The compliance statement for the policyMIB.

polComplianceV11.name: polComplianceV11
polComplianceV11.description: The compliance statement for the policyMIB for version 1.1.

polComplianceV12.name: polComplianceV12
polComplianceV12.description: The compliance statement for the policyMIB for version 1.2.

polComplianceV13.name: polComplianceV13
polComplianceV13.description: The compliance statement for the policyMIB for version 1.3.

polGroupV10.name: polGroupV10
polGroupV10.description: A set of managed objects that make up version 1.0 of the SSR Flow Policy MIB.

polGroupV11.name: polGroupV11
polGroupV11.description: A set of managed objects that make up version 1.1 of the SSR Flow Policy MIB.

polGroupV12.name: polGroupV12
polGroupV12.description: A set of managed objects that make up version 1.2 of the SSR Flow Policy MIB.

polGroupV13.name: polGroupV13
polGroupV13.description: A set of managed objects that make up version 1.3 of the SSR Flow Policy MIB.
